data.message: I want to be able to select the friends I want to share with. Some things are of no interest to everybody on my friends list.

replies.message: Hi Judy. You'll find an audience selector tool most places you share status updates, photos and anything else. Just click the tool and select who you want to share something with. Learn more: http://on.fb.me/1vdv2pO. -Chantal
Thanks. I'll look for it; but I haven't seen an audience tool.
Is this available on mobile devices?
Glenna, I don't use the Facebook app, but when I post on Facebook using my mobile browser, I have the option to pick my audience.
When selecting the Share option, instead of using "Share Now" sub option in the iOS app, I use the "Write Post" sub option which allows me to select specific individuals or groups.

Karen that doesn't work with the recent update. I remember that option before updating
and miss it. I don't know why FB takes good features away.
post as only me and tag whom u want to see your stuf  simple :)

You no longer can select a friend by just typing their name.  I have sent a problem report to Facebook but haven't heard anything back!  I hate that they removed this from feature!  I created a "friend list" with 1 person in each list BUT now you can't see that you shared the post with just them - just as they can't see it was shared with just them.  This infuriates me and I wish they would fix this!

That isn't much of a problem, for me, to send it out to certain people and include them. What bugs me is when I want to EXCLUDE people, I can't do it on certain devices or certain posts. Sometimes it's only one or two people and basically, I have to type everyone's else's name to include them and not the other person... It doesn't necessarily hide it from them, though. So annoying.
Wow heres a strange one . My 4 messages are gone . Wth ?? Now theyll show back up
